verses.roman:
nirantara rātri-dina viraha unmāde
hāse, kānde, nāce, gāya parama viṣāde

synonyms: nirantara—without cessation; rātri-dina—night and day; viraha—of separation; unmāde—in madness; hāse—laughs; kānde—cries; nāce—dances; gāya—chants; parama—great; viṣāde—in moroseness.
translation: In the attitude of separation, Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu appeared mad both day and night. Sometimes He laughed, and sometimes He cried; sometimes He danced, and sometimes He chanted in great sorrow.
